entry.title: Ninotchka
entry.content:
I fell in love with Greta Garbo after watching this film. That may seem a strange thing to say, since she is 50 years my senior, but its true. Garbo is not known for her comedy. As far as I can remember Ninotchka is the only comedy she ever made. But she really did have a talent for it. Garbo plays the Russian official Ninotchka, sent to Paris to negotiate the return of some of the Russian crown jewels currently in the hands of an exiled Grand Duchess. The Grand Duchess has hired a lawyer to represent her case in the courts of France. While exploring Paris Ninotchka finds herself falling in love with a man she met on the street even though he seems to represent everything she is against. As it turns out, not only are their cultures at odds, so are their business lives as he is the lawyer representing the Grand Duchess. In the end you know that love will triumph but it is fun getting there. There is a scene is a small restaurant where Garbo laughs, something she did not do often in her films. Pity, she is beautiful when she laughs.

Garbo is not alone in Paris; there are three other Russian officials with her. The only thing I will say about them is that are almost, but not quite The Three Stooges. They are gentler and softer spoken, but they could have been easily replaced by Larry, Moe, and Curley. In other words, they were perfect for the parts they played.

Ninotchka was later remade as the musical Silk Stockings with Fred Astaire and Cyd Charisse. This version features great dancing, but comes nowhere near being able to capture the charm of the original.

The only issue with Ninotchka is that it is an older film. Filmed in 1939 it has the sometimes stilted language of the films from this time period. Some may even take issue that the movie is black and white. I know many people who avoid old movies because they are not in color. They dont know what they are missing. Ninotchka may be a little dated in style and language, and the stereotypes are heavy. The film is not PC by todays standards, but it will make you laugh.

My Final Word: Did I tell you I fell in love with Greta Garbo after watching this film? .

entry.title: The Curious Case of Benjamin Button
entry.content:
Did I ever tell you I was struck by lightning seven times? For some reason this is the line that I remember most out of all the spoken lines in the Curious Case of Benjamin Button. Its not because it has anything to do with the plot of the movie. Its because it is repeated five times (I counted) by one of the residents in the old folks home that Benjamin calls home through out his life.
If you have seen the trailer you know the plot. Benjamin (played by Brad Pitt through most of the film) was born under unusual circumstances. He was born old and gets younger as he ages. Once you accept this impossibility the movie is a pleasant and enjoyable watch. With a running time of two hours and forty-six minutes, I only found myself checking my watch once, and that was to try to decide whether I could make it to end of the movie without pausing it in order to use the restroom. The movie is not as much about Benjamins condition as it is about the relationships he develops. His affliction adds interest to the relationships by providing an unusual backdrop. The story could easily have been told about any normal growing boy, but it would not have been as interesting. For example his first sexual encounter occurs while he is very young. Not uncommon in stories, but add to this the idea that the people around him and providing him with the experience think he is in his late sixties or early seventies then it takes on a whole new feeling.
If I had any problem with the movie it had to do with the ending. It required of me a little more suspension of belief than I was able to give it. But I dont want to say why because I dont want to spoil the ending. It was pleasantly touching and really would not have been so if the issue had been dealt with any other way. My way would have been sad; their way was sad and sweet at the same time.
My Final Word: The Curious Case of Benjamin Button is not for everyone. The humor is subtle, and there is really no action adventure of any kind. But it is a warm story that says much about the relationships that we develop in life and the age stereotypes we develop. I intend to watch this movie again and not just once but several times.

entry.title: Bride Wars
entry.content:
Bride Wars is a film with an almost completely predictable ending. This is not a bad thing as the film is not about the ending, but about the journey to get there. Kate Hudson and Anne Hathaway star as two best friends who share a common dream, to be married at the Plaza. When an accident results in their weddings being scheduled for the same day, at the same time, in different rooms at the hotel the war starts. Each one of them tries to sabotage the others wedding, so that they can have their special day. The battles start small and grow bigger and more grandiose as the day approaches. Once you get over the idea that these best of friends would not settle for their boy friends' suggestion of a double wedding you can sit back and enjoy the ride. You know that everything will work out in the end.

If the film has any problem it is that it tries to tell two stories at once and the second story disappears almost completely. This second story involves Anne Hathaways character and pops out of almost nowhere towards the end of the film. If the story had been developed more or left out entirely it would have been a better film

I love watching Anne Hathaway. She has a face that works well for comedy. It is expressive, funny and beautiful all at the same time. She has a strong sense of comic timing. If she had been around film and TV in the late 50s and early 60s she would have given Lucille Ball some strong competition. Kate Hudsons character suited her. I had not realized that she was Goldie Hawns daughter. I could see much of her mother in her performance and that is saying something. In some ways the two reminded me Lucy and Ethel in the old I Love Lucy show. I hope they work together again.

My Final Word: This film made me laugh and except for the secondary story line satisfied me. I might even watch it again, just so I can have the pleasure of watching Kate Hudson and Anne Hathaway work together.

entry.title: Milk
entry.content: Since I knocked crazy Sean Penn in my last post, I guess I'd better back it up. Yes, I saw Milk, which is a good movie. The film tells the story of Harvey Milk, the first openly gay elected official. I knew some of the story, but I didn't know Milk's background- how he repeatedly was defeated before finally getting elected to some kind of office. And Milk's relentless pursuit of forwarding the gay cause at the expense of his personal life was fascinating. I found the editing a little choppy, but it was a good movie overall. I know Penn won the Oscar for the lead role, and yes, it is a role that is very un-Sean Penn-like. The character is very smiley and emotional, not what we usually see from Penn. What bothered me the whole time was I found Penn to use many of the mannerisms and speech patterns that he used to play a developmentally disabled character in I Am Sam. That disturbed me and put an interesting skew on the whole movie! Not what I consider Oscar worthy. Emile Hirsch is nearly unrecognizable in his role as a Milk campaign worker.

entry.title: The Wrestler
entry.content: Sorry, crazy Sean Penn who's having a mid-life crisis, but Mickey Rourke deserved the Oscar. His complete lack of vanity in playing Randy "The Ram" Robinson, a washed-up, has-been wrestler from the '80s makes this movie nearly perfect. Don't look for upbeat, happy endings with this film. It's a stunning drama about The Ram on the downward slope of a poorly lived life. He's misused and abused everyone and everything in his life- including his body. It is shocking to see the way wrestlers abuse themselves to keep performing, even when those performances are no longer in sold out arenas, but in pitifully small venues. The Ram is looking at one last chance at greatness in a comeback match against his biggest rival. Since nothing else is going right in his life- he tries to reconcile with his daughter, get a "normal" job, have a relationship with a stripper, his health is failing- the match looks like his only hope. But can his body withstand it? I don't know how Mickey Rourke's body withstood the punishment it had to take for him to play this role. But it was certainly the role of a lifetime!

entry.title: Find Me Guilty
entry.content:
Find Me Guilty is the true story of Jack DiNorsio ( played by Vin Diesel) who defended himself in one of the longest and largest Mafia trails in history. DiNorsios biggest handicap is his education. He doesnt have any. His second largest handicap is that he is on trial with a large number of his fellows, and if he goes down, they go down with him. Suddenly he has become very unpopular with his former friends.

From what I have been told the court room scenes which make up the bulk of the movie come almost completely from the court transcripts. If this is true, I think I would like to meet Jack DiNorsio, as long as I was on his good side. The move trailer gives the impression that the film is a comedy. Watching the film you realize that it is not. However, Jack DiNorsio would be at home in any stand-up comedy club in America. He may be a hood, but he is a funny and friendly one. I found myself laughing more at his court room antics than I have laughed at many so called comedies made today.

To answer one question that I am sure comes to many of your minds,can Vin Diesel act? The answer is that he can. Diesel may be best known for his action films where his characters all have been one dimensional cartoons, but here he is given room to develop. This film proves he can compete with the best of them. Having seen the film, I can not picture anyone else playing the role of Jack DiNorsio. It is a pity that Vin Diesel has been cast in so many action films. He could be one of the best character actors in the business today.

My Final Word:If you havent seen this film, pick it up. If you have been avoiding this film because it stars Vin Diesel and you dont like him or dont think he can act, watch this film, it will change your mind.

entry.title: Seven Pounds
entry.content:
Seven Pounds is one of the most interesting films I have seen in a long time. Not since I watched Memento have I been as confused by a film yet riveted to the screen at the same time. Memento if you have not seen the film is about a man with short term memory loss who is trying to reconstruct the death of his wife, but his short term memory is only about three minutes. The movie starts with the present and follows the protagonist as he tries to investigate the crime, while writing notes to himself in order to not to forget what he has found out.

Seven Pounds tells the story of Ben Thomas (Will Smith) as he seeks to enrich the lives of seven people. As the story begins you are not sure exactly what he is doing, or why. Like Memento the back story is only slowly revealed and you, as the viewer, have the task of putting all of the links together. This type of story telling, where the character knows more than the audience, is very hard to do, but when done well it make the viewer a participant in story. Seven Pounds does it well. If I have any complaint it is that the last scene seems like it was added at the request of the studio to make the ending a little lighter. I would have ended the film five minutes earlier.

My Final Word: Seven Pounds is a good watch and it will involve you in the process. For part of the film I wondered, What is he doing? By the time I realized what he was doing, I was hooked, and I wanted to know how and if he was going to do it.

entry.title: Red Dwarf -TV Series
entry.content:
It all started with a cat named Frankenstein. If it hadnt been for the cat, Dave Lister never would have been put in stasis and he would not have survived the radiation leak that killed the entire human crew of the mining ship Red Dwarf. That is the background story of the British television series Red Dwarf.

Dave Lister is the lowest ranked member of the member of the ships crew. His only real delight is making his bunkmate Arnold Rimmers life miserable. When Dave is punished for bringing a cat on board, he is put into status for 6 months without pay. Shortly thereafter a radiation leak kills the entire crew and the ships computer sends the ship far out into space to protect the shipping lanes. Several million years later, after the radiation levels have dropped, the computer releases Lister from stasis and provides him with a holographic version of his former bunkmate as a companion. Rimmer is a by the book incompetent with delusions of adequacy. Lister is a slacker, who thinks nothing of trimming his toenails in publicwith his teeth. They are joined by the last of a race of humanoid cats that evolved from the Listers cat Frankenstein. From here on life is a series of misadventures that became one of the most successful comedy hits in British Television. Im not sure why it works, but it does.

Like any series, the shows are sometimes uneven,but there are some truly great episodes. Backwards features the boys in a universe that is contracting and everything is going backwards. You rise from the grave, live your life growing younger and finally are placed into your mothers womb. The people of this earth find themselves looking forward to WWII, when hundreds of thousands of people are raised from the dead. And only the British could come up with such an interesting answer to the ongoing debate over the Kennedy assassination and the shooter on the grassy knoll.

My Final Word: Red Dwarf is not for everyone. But if you like British Comedy and science fiction it is one of the best shows around.

entry.title: The Spirit
entry.content:
I heard a lot about The Spirit before watching the film, very little of it good, so I was not expecting much when I sat down to watch the DVD. Often I am pleasantly surprised and find a movie is much better than my expectations (See my earlier review of Meet Dave). The Spirit did surprise me, not because it was better than my expectations, it was worse than I had heard. Sad, because I loved director Frank Millers "Sin City and knew a little about The Spirit comic this film was based on and I have to admit I love the poster. I wont even try to describe the storyline. Im still trying to figure it out myself.
Perhaps the biggest problem with the film is that it looked like Sin City and sounded like the 1960s Batman TV show, full of camp and comedy. The style of writing didnt match what I saw. The films one saving feature was Samuel L. Jackson and his band of villains. I found myself laughing almost every time they were on screen. A better, more over the top villain I have rarely seen.
My Final Word: Watch it for the Villains.

entry.title: Fireproof
entry.content:
What can I say about Fireproof? I was fond of the film and repulsed by it at the same time. This is a heavy hand Christian Message film that nevertheless deals with issues that face a great many marriages. Kirk Cameron (remember Growing Pains) plays a firefighter whose marriage is going up in smoke. At the request of his father he does a 40 day love dare to save his marriage. He begins performing the daily love challenges reluctantly at first but finally with his whole heart. The dare will change him as much or more it will change his wife. If this had been the primary message of the film it would have worked better and appealed to a wider audience. This story, however, often takes a back seat to the proselytizing of the salvation message. While I am sure that this was one of the primary reasons the company had for making the film, they might have succeeded better had they focused less on this aspect of their message and more on the problems and resolutions that took place in the couples relationship.
My Final Word: Fireproof is a film about real problems, faced by real people and it is often interesting and thought provoking. There were times, like the whole first half-hour, that I felt I was watching a skit at a church camp, but over all I found the film made me think about my actions and thoughts towards my wife and I found myself asking myself when was the last time I had told her how much I loved her.

entry.title: Transporter 3
entry.content:
Transporter 3 is the latest in the series of adventures of Frank Martin a driver who always delivers the package to its final destination no matter what it takes, or who has to die in the process. Jason Statham returns once again in this action packed, high speed film of the impossible. This time Frank is really attached to his car, in fact, if he strays further than 75 feet from his BMW a bracelet on his wrist will explode taking him with it. In addition he finds himself saddled with the beautiful woman Valentina, played by Natalya Rudakova, who is, for some unknown reason, sporting the same piece of jewelry.

From this point on the plot really doesnt matter, after all who cares about the plot when you can see some of the most amazing car chases, stunts and fights you will ever see in any movie. Just as you dont watch a Jackie Chan movie for the plot, but to see Jackie mug, and fight his way through it, you watch a Transporter movie for action. The plot is incidental. Perhaps the greatest mystery regarding the Transporter series of movies isnt why they are popular, but how does his car keep moving?

My Final Word: Full of action, if you like that kind of film you'll love this one.

Meet Dave

When I watch a movie I am looking for one of two things. Either I want to be challenged to think or I want to be mindlessly entertained without having to think. Almost every movie I choose to watch falls into one or both of these categories to a greater or lesser degree. Meet Dave, staring Eddie Murphy, falls totally and completely into the latter category. In fact making any effort to think about what is going on in this movie would completely have destroyed my enjoyment. This movie is about slapstick, rubber faces and totally impossible situations. It is a mindless waste of time that nevertheless made me laugh.
Meet Dave" is about group of very small aliens that have lost a device to steal the earths water. They have come to earth in a spaceship which looks just like Eddie Murphy. The captain of the crew looks just like the spaceship, they have only a limited knowledge of earth culture and apparently, even less control of the ship itself. While on earth they find themselves faced with trying to fit into earth culture while becoming infected by strange new feelings called emotions. Ive not been a fan of Eddie Murphy since his Beverly Hills Cop days, but his rubbery features as an alien/robot/spaceship made this movie work for me.
Is the plot lame? Yes! Is the script good? No! Are there plot holes so large you could drive a truck through them? No, they are much, much, much larger than that. Did I like the movie? Yes. Despite all of its failings it made me laugh and forget about work, bills, and even my dogs muddy paw prints across the carpet.
My Final Word: I dont know if it would hold up to a second watching, which is my test for a truly good movie. I doubt it, but I didnt regret the first viewing.
